problem_text:
A group G is said to be para-free if all factors γi(G)/γi+1(G) of its lower central series are isomorphic to the corresponding lower central factors of some free group, and ⋂∞ i=1 γi(G) = 1. Is an arbitrary para-free group representable by matrices over a commutative-associative ring with 1?
A. N. Zubkov
